main.name: Owen Parkins
main.description: Pen Tester. Software Developer. System Admin.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.
main.contactInfo: The best way to contact me is through email. Click the link below to retrieve my email address.

resume.objective: I am seeking a full time position to apply my proven leadership and technical skills by combining my expertise in software development, vulnerability analysis, and exploit development. I enhance my technical skills with my extensive system administration and network management experience. I am highly self-motivated and thrive in a challenging environment that requires continual learning.
resume.skillmessage: I am success-oriented, self-motivated, and a natural leader with strong communication and presentation skills. I quickly adapt to new technology and changing project parameters.

work.title: Cyber Security Research and Development Intern
description: Conducted a software and hardware vulnerability analysis on a commercial mobile router and delivered a report detailing vulnerabilities and mitigation suggestions
Enhanced a vulnerability analysis tracking application by removing bugs and adding new features to both the client- and server-side components.
Analyzed the likelihood of a vulnerability being present in a proprietary SSH implementation by reverse engineering a PowerPC-based firmware image using Ghidra
Developed proof of concept exploit code for Urgent/11 vulnerabilities targeting VxWorks OS.
Created an Ansible script to deploy and manage VMs on an ESXi host.

work.title: Technical Intern
description: Developed attack vectors and completed preliminary analysis during a voting machine audit. Worked to explore potential attack vectors with team of cybersecurity researchers.

Provided comparative analysis of tools like Nmap and Ettercap to support the California Energy Systems for the 21st Century research efforts. The analysis included networking scanning tools on industrial control systems.
Supported the dynamic line rating (DLR) project funded by the Wind Energy Technologies Office. Reported vulnerabilities and possible mitigations for the DLR solution.

work.title: Parallel Cluster System Administrator
description: Designed a cluster to use IPMI to manage physical nodes, provision with DigitalRebar, and deploy OpenStack through Kolla for the Secure System Administration class.
Designed to run malware and be quarantined from external network connections.

work.company: Earth and Environmental Science Department, New Mexico Tech
work.title: Software Engineer
description: Debugging a parallel 3D finite-element solver that couples groundwater flow, heat, and transport equations.
Maintains multiple high performance computers. Provides regular updates and support for a multiple systems running different Linux and Windows operating systems.

Inherited a previously developed software solution that calculates the density of water based on temperature and pressure. Converted the code from FORTRAN to MATLAB to use the solvers present in MATLAB. This enabled other faculty members to use the equation of state code in their own programs.
Converted MATLAB code that calculated the stress on ice sheets to FORTRAN. This was to increase the speed of the calculations by decreasing the overhead of running the library in MATLAB.

work.title: Software Engineer Intern
description: Worked with a team to migrate existing iOS application to the Universal Windows Platform. Created code generators written in Java to generate base entities in C#. Implemented platform-specific classes that supported the application.

work.title: Year-Round Technical Intern
description: Developed the AutoTest Management Program for the Nuclear Accident Analysis Division. This software is used to test the results of MELCOR, a nuclear reactor modeling program, against earlier results to check for consistency of the application.
Set up a continuous integration system using Jenkins CI. This system enabled MELCOR developers to accelerate the software development lifecycle of MELCOR.

cyber_activities.title: Security Audits
description: Perform network security audits for various organizations around New Mexico
Audits include social engineering an organization’s employees, performing network scans, and creating remediation reports detailing vulnerabilities found and possible mitigation actions.

cyber_activities.title: NSA Codebreaker
description: One of twenty individuals to complete all tasks in the 2018 competition
Participated in the 2016 competition and was offered a letter of recognition from the NSA

cyber_activities.title: Department of Energy CyberForce Red Team
description: Participated on Sandia National Laboratories’ Red Team for the competition
Practiced exploits against various operating systems, prepared scripts for post-exploitation, and learned ICS vulnerabilities

cyber_activities.title: Wireless CTF
description: Participated in Idaho National Laboratory’s Wireless CTF Competition
Practiced using aircrack-ng tool suite to defeat WEP and WPA2 protected networks

volunteering.title: Socorro Search and Rescue
description: Vice President of the student-based team. Responsibilities consist of coordinating with State Police and supervising various school activities. Completed New Mexico’s State Certification for search and rescue and Operations Section Chief training

projects.title: Sundial (Work In Progress)
projects.description: Sundial is designed to help manage time and tasks. It provides a simple user interface that enables users to keep on task throughout their day. Sundial will prioritize tasks so that the nearest deadline is at the top of the list. This application is continuously subjected to redesigns with new user interfaces and new libraries. Sundial is used as a testing ground for new technologies. I am currently rewriting it and looking forward to releasing it publically on GitHub.

projects.title: House Infrastructure
projects.description: I am using Ubuntu (next time will be CentOS) as my base operating system and a hypervisor. I am using a virtualized pfSense as my router. pfSense provides DHCP, DNS, OpenVPN, and more services for my home network. On the same physical machine, connected via a virtual bridge, I use lxc containers for Unifi controller and Plex media server. I plan to use lxc containers to provide DHCP and DNS instead of using pfSense. This will allow the network to function if pfSense fails.

projects.title: 1975 Honda CB200T Rebuild
projects.description: I am working on my first motorcycle rebuild project. It is a 1975 Honda CB200T motorcycle. I am using this project to learn more about vehicle rebuilds. Currently, I am finishing the electrical system on the motorcycle.

projects.title: AuctionBoost
projects.description: AuctionBoost is software that is used for managing the check-in and check-out process at auctions. It enables organizations to provide quicker and more professional service to their guests. The software is capable of tracking guests and items throughout an auction. When guests first sign in on this software, they are given a bid card number as described by the auction's settings inside the software. When the guests check out, they can know what they bought right away – auctions no longer need to use other data sheet software to track their auction. This software will be open-sourced soon. The repository needs to be cleaned up.

projects.title: Reference Monitor with xv6
projects.description: xv6 is a unix-like that is used to teach operating systems. This team-based project for the graduate level operating systems class is to implemenet a reference monitor within the xv6 operating system. This project was completed in Spring 2019. We found that it was immpossible to implement a true reference monitor in xv6. In fact, xv6 already has a reference monitor implemented in the form of virtual memory. Originally, our concept of a reference monitor was a actually device or implementation. While working on this project, we found that the reference monitor is a concept, not an implementation. While we did not succeed with our original goal, we came away with a deeper understanding of a reference monitor.
